metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2105 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the EVP_EncodeUpdate function in crypto/evp/encode.c in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via a large amount of binary data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2105` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu5
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu5').
